paragraphs: On Sunday, September 21, a parade of historical and modern trams will take place in the center of Prague. This event will symbolically mark the 150th anniversary of Prague's public transportation system.
A column of 40 trains from different eras will pass through the central streets. Some of them will only cover part of the route.
At the head of the procession will be wagon 240, harnessed with horses, followed by wagon 90, passenger wagon 200, excursion wagon 500, motor wagon 88 (from 1900), and other historical compositions.
It will not do without representatives of modernity, namely trams 14T, 15T, and the newest 52T, the designer T3 Coupé, as well as technical wagons.
Trams will gather at 09:30 on the section between Křižíkova and Urxova.
The townspeople will have an hour and a half to inspect them and take pictures.
🆓 Entry to the event is free.
🚃 Exactly at 11:00, the column will set off on the following route:
Those who wish will be able to participate in the parade and ride on some trams.
Tickets for the train cars can be purchased at the official online store of the Prague Transport Company.
